alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Western Franklin; Western Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 12:56PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hampshire and central Franklin Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 1256 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Goshen, or 11 miles northwest of Northampton, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... Greenfield, Orange, Deerfield, Montague, Sunderland, Northfield, Williamsburg, Bernardston, Buckland, Conway, Shelburne, Leverett, Erving, Ashfield, Colrain, Gill, Whately, Charlemont, Chesterfield and Worthington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed.
